skillTree.localised_description: The Thaumaturge’s Bane boasts a wickedly curved blade, its surface etched with ancient runes of binding and banishment. Each swing of this formidable weapon crackles with an aura of suppressed chaos, the very antithesis of the structured energies wielded by sorcerers and mages. Even the most powerful of wizards tremble at the sight of this dread weapon, knowing that their arcane mastery is no match for the dark forces it embodies.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Enraged Corpses

skillTree.localised_description: It was during a bloody campaign against the forces of Order that Barukh's fate took a sinister turn. Amidst the ruins of a besieged city, he stumbled upon an ancient tomb, its entrance obscured by the sands of time. Drawn by an irresistible curiosity, Barukh delved into the depths of the tomb, heedless of the warnings carved upon its weathered stones. Within the tomb, he discovered forbidden knowledge buried by a grim and dark hand – the Crown of Sorcery. The dark arts imbued within the Crown called out to him, promising untold power and dominion over life and death. Unable to resist their allure, Barukh delved deeper into the forbidden lore, his soul becoming ensnared by the circlet upon his brow. As he emerged from the tomb, Barukh was forever changed. No longer content to merely wield the might of his axe and the fury of his rage, he had become something more – a puppet of the necromantic arts, his body commanded by the fell energies of the undead.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Blood everywhere and fatal wounds. There's no walking away from this.
Some warriors care not for their own personal safety, and so work themselves into a whirlwind of destruction and mindless violence!

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Looking absolutely hideous is a distinct advantage if you actually want others to be afraid of you.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: As a Bull Centaur ages, their flesh hardens like metal – harder to hurt, quicker to heal, and better at resisting magical attack.
The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.
Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…
Whenever a unit dies in Barukh's presence, its energy is stolen by the Crown of Sorcery and fed into itself.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates when an enemy unit is destroyed within 30 metres

skillTree.localised_description: Even as Barukh carved a bloody swath across the Dark Lands, his former kin looked upon him with disdain and revulsion. To them, he was no longer a hero of the Chaos Dwarves, but a twisted abomination, a slave to the very forces he had sought to master.
The Crown of Sorcery came with an unexpected gift of knowledge - the ability to utilize the dark magic of Arnzipal's Black Horror. Provided the Crown was suitably placated by the souls of the dead.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Called from the corpses of the dead by the magic of the Crown, the bones of the slain fuse themselves to Barukh's body, plating him over and providing him with a grim shield.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

skillTree.localised_description: The Crown of Sorcery drains the lifeforce from Barukh's "allies", siphoning it away to give the Bull Centaur a massive burst of energy. As long as it's a cost he does not have to pay, Barukh does not care.
Braugh forces the unruliest of spirits into a state of explosive deconstruction, casting them into the fray as they rip themselves asunder in dangerous bursts.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

related_attributes.bullet_text:
Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform
Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Gaze of Nagash"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Gaze of Nagash Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Gaze of Nagash Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Barukh the Contemptuous now rides at the head of a macabre procession, his centaur body adorned with the trappings of death, leading his undead horde in a relentless march.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Enraged Corpses
Summons a unit of Enraged Corpses

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Curse of Years"

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Wind of Death"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Wind of Death Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wind of Death Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Enraged Corpses

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: From his earliest days, Barukh displayed an insatiable thirst for power, his ambition matched only by his contempt for those he deemed unworthy. As a Bull Centaur, he stood apart from his kin, towering above them in both stature and ambition. It is his greed that has served him well, leading him from triumph to triumph, but some knowledges are not meant for mortal beings.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform
